titleStmt.title: The interest of England how it consists in vnity of the Protestant religion. With expedients moderate and effectuall to establish it by the extirpation of the papacy. By a member of the House of Commons.
titleStmt.author: Constantine, William, Sir, 1611 or 12-1670.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by E. Griffin, for Lawrence Blaicklocke, and are to be sold at his shop at the Sugar-loafe in Fleet-Streete next to Temple-Bar ,

notesStmt.note: Address "to the reader" signed: William Constantine.
Attributed to William Constantine. cf. BLC.
Another work by this author was published in London, 1645, with title: The second part of the interest of England considered as it relates to the government of the church.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop at the Sugar-loafe in Fleet-Streete next to Temple-Bar
